data.title: Ubon Ratchathani Travel Guide : 12 Things To Do in Ubon Thailand

data.meta_description: Ubon Ratchathani travel guide. Located in Northeast of Thailand, explore the famous Sam Phan Bok, Pha Taem National Park, cotton hand-woven
data.text:
The Grand Canyon of Thailand is located in Pho Sai district, Ubon Ratchathani. The place had been developed over millions years ago. The Mekong Grand Canyon is one of the nature wonder that can be noticed during the dry season

Sam Phan Bok (Sam Phan = 3000) and Bok (holes) that was created from swirling water eroded sandstone rocks into unique shapes. The beautiful rocks shape that can be expected to see at ‘3000 Bok Lake’ such as the Micky Mouse, Dog and Bird Shape. One of the highlight is the emerald pool that you could’t afford to miss!

*The weather can be very hot during the day, better prepare sunscreen / cap / sunglasses

A unique geographic (the large cliff) represented the history of an ancient paintings on the rocks that located right by Mekong River has been one of the popular national park in Thailand

Pha Taem (อุทยานแห่งชาติผาแต้ม)also offers the nature loop trial approximately 4km that will take around 2hrs to complete. The trial will allow you to explore more than 300 paintings on the stone wall with difference shapes such as people, animals, utensils, symbols, and human palms

The Memory Cafe (ความทรงจำคาเฟ่) located near Pha Taem National Park, right by Mekong river. The restaurant is famous among locals and can be busy especially on weekends

The view overlook Laos landscape that has a wide Mekong river acted as the border between two countries. In dry season, we can walk through the small sand island to the middle of the river

the biggest waterfall in Northeast Thailand (45m height) is located in Phu Chong Na Yoi National Park (อุทยานแห่งชาติภูจอง-นายอย) covered three border of Ubon, Laos and Kingdom of Cambodia, known as the Emerald Triangle

To reach Hui Luang Waterfall (น้ำตกห้วยหลวง), you need to take 300 stair steps through the nature trail to reach the waterfall that has been one of the local’s favorite, you can expect to see people swim and picnic around the waterfall

Tips: Entrance Fee Thai Child 20THB/Adult 40THB, Foreigner Child 100THB/Adult 200THB, Open Daily 08.30-16.30

Phu Prao Temple (วัดภูพร้าว) located in Chong Mek, on top of Phu Prao (Prao Hill) has the viewpoint that overlook Mekong river and Thai-Laos border crossing point

‍

The glowing temple (วัดสิรินธรวรารามภูพร้าว)is the name known by most travelers, has been one of the tourist top destination in Ubon Ratchathani. The Ubosot will illuminate at night, the beautiful trees and flowers shape on the ground had been painted in illuminated colors that will shine brightly in the dark

The Khao Phra Wihan National Park (อุทยานแห่งชาติเขาพระวิหาร) is a home of a famous Khao Phra Wihan Temple that located right in-between Thai and Cambodia border

Pha Mor E Daeng Cliff (ผามออีแดง)situated 500m from Cambodia plain, has the stair along the cliff that allow you to explore the ancient sculpture on the stone wall that aged more than 1,500 years old

The panoramic viewpoint overlook Cambodia landscape, locals usually

come in the morning for sunrise and expected to see the sea of clouds early in the morning (good chance if it was raining the day before)

Tips: Entrance fee Thai child 20THB, Adult 40THB. Foreigner Child 100THB, Adult 200THB. Open Daily 05.00 – 16.00

*Pha Mor E Daeng is located in Si Sa Ket Province, has the border next to Ubon Ratchathani (travelers usually make a trip to Pha Mor E Dang when visited Ubon Ratchathani)

City center is where locals are gathering, you can also find the museum and the signature big candle sculpture that used in temple during raining season (July) known as The Candle Festival or Khao Phansa (one of the important festival for Thai Buddhism)

Nearby Attractions: Chao Phra Prathum Worarat Suriyawong (Chao Khamphong) Monument and Public Park, Thung Sri Muang Night Market, Wat Thung Si Mueang

On daily basis, locals usually went to Tung Sri Muang (ทุ่งศรีเมือง) for exercise, it can be crowded in the morning and evening. The area surrounded by local restaurants and street food that will give your stomach a big smile
